revised_title: Vibrational and Rotational Analysis of the Free NCO Radical's Absorption Spectrum
tldr: The authors studied the absorption spectrum of the free NCO radical using flash photolysis and found that the spectrum is due to an electronic transition of the free NCO radical, which is linear in both states. They obtained all three vibrational frequencies and first-order anharmonic constants for the upper state and determined the rotational constants for some levels in the lower state. The study also revealed a Fermi resonance and the influence of the Renner effect on the vibrational structure of the lower state.
